alert.note: Alert for Chattooga; Floyd; Gordon; Walker; Whitfield (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 3:42PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Floyd, southwestern Whitfield, southeastern Walker, northwestern Gordon and northeastern Chattooga Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 342 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Subligna, or 11 miles northeast of Summerville, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Calhoun, Resaca, Mill Creek, Subligna, Suttles Mill, Villanow, Sugar Valley, Everett Springs and Lake Marvin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
